googleReviewsBySlug.json.name: Robin Shempert
googleReviewsBySlug.json.text: Raymond did 2 outstanding jobs for me then the next one took my $240 and never heard from him again.
googleReviewsBySlug.json.responseFromOwnerText: Mrs Robin, we're certainly happy that you were satisfied with the services received in the past from Shamrock. We do apologize for the experience you had trying to obtain our services on your next project. Although words can never correct a negative experience we would still like to offer it sincerest regret for the inconveniences and expense incurred by our failure to fulfill our not only our obligation but our dedication to your repairs and satisfactory outcome. In no way to try and justify the poor experience you had, not to make excuses for our lack of communication but feel an explanation is due at the least. As we all learn life happens, schedules get busy, time gets away from us. Although this is solely our responsibility and poorly handled, myself and wife were involved In a horrific auto accident that left both of us on life support and multiple injuries requiring several surgeries and a long recovery. As this is a personal affair and our privacy and time to heal was an important part of our recovery, we feel that this could have been handled In a more appropriate manner and would like to make this right by fulfilling our agreement and obligation to you. While we don't expect you to forgive our lack of duty, we do sincerely hope you can accept our apology. We will be in touch soon or feel free to email us anytime @ shamrockhomerepairs@gmail.com
googleReviewsBySlug.json.title: Shamrock Home Repairs

googleReviewsBySlug.json.name: Grant Watson
googleReviewsBySlug.json.text: After being quoted by two well known roofing companies that I needed a new roof,  Raymond was able to find the leak and fixed the problem.  What he thought was initially the problem he later discovered was a short cut the builder had done to the roof and fixed that problem as well.  I would definitely recommend Raymond and would use again.
googleReviewsBySlug.json.responseFromOwnerText: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with Shamrock Home Repairs. We're glad that you were satisfied with our services and that we were able to fix the problem versus having a total roof replacement. We strive to offer the lowest cost estimate to our customers with any quote while being able to locate and correct the problem with high quality products and service. Thank you for calling on Shamrock and the generous tip you gave. Call us again if you need us, and don't forget your 5 year labor warranty covers your repair should you ever have any issues again.
googleReviewsBySlug.json.title: Shamrock Home Repairs

googleReviewsBySlug.json.name: Sandra Holsomback
googleReviewsBySlug.json.responseFromOwnerText: We're sorry to hear you were not fully satisfied with the service you received, however, possibly you made a mistaken rating meant for another business. To date Shamrock Home Repairs has no record of any services requested by you or performed by us for you. We're confident that you've mistaken us for another company and not part of a small group entertaining their selves with public shaming, leaving false, negative comments on social media on local businesses. Slander is illegal and punishable by law. We however, hope this is not the case and hope you get your issues resolved.
googleReviewsBySlug.json.title: Shamrock Home Repairs

googleReviewsBySlug.json.name: Melissa Snider
googleReviewsBySlug.json.text: Built a beautiful deck for our 1958 bungalow. Every old house comes with special surprises; Shamrock upgraded our old porch foundation and redesigned the existing structure to suit our needs, without charging extra for the additional work. We’re so pleased with the results!
googleReviewsBySlug.json.responseFromOwnerText: Thank you Melissa for your positive review! We're so glad that you're pleased with your new deck and was satisfied with our services. Here's to a Merry Christmas and Happy New Year. Hope you enjoy your deck for years to come!!
googleReviewsBySlug.json.title: Shamrock Home Repairs

googleReviewsBySlug.json.name: Cindy Free
googleReviewsBySlug.json.text: Mr. Roop was hired to finish some renovations to several posts on my front porch, back patio, and shed. He did a great job despite several issues that made the job difficult and unique. He remained patient with changes I made mid-way through the job and made several trips to pick up materials needed.  He was very polite and patient and was very flexible with his schedule to accommodate me. He stayed within budget which was very reasonable.
googleReviewsBySlug.json.responseFromOwnerText: Thank you Cindy for your positive review! I'm glad we was able to complete your renovation within your budget and to your satisfaction. It was an absolute pleasure meeting and working with you on your home repairs.
googleReviewsBySlug.json.title: Shamrock Home Repairs

googleReviewsBySlug.json.name: Julia Johnson
googleReviewsBySlug.json.text: Has been a nightmare dealing with Raymond Roop of Shamrock Home Repairs!  He told me he had a ladder tall enough to replace my cathedral ceiling fan.  He did not.  Tried to work on it using a tall ladder on one of my plastic folding tables.  Of course, that is not stable enough. He cut the wires too short when taking down the existing fan and that caused problems.  He would say he was going to show up and work on it, and then not show up. (This happened several days.) Should have just said he couldn't do it.  Did not communicate well with me.  There were other projects I wanted him to do.  He did a few of those to begin with and I paid him, even though he said I wouldn't have to pay him until all the jobs were completed.  He asked for some money on the fan job the first day.  He got the fan partially installed but the wires were bunched up and shoved up in to the down rod. Installation not complete. Very unprofessional.  Very unreliable.  I would not recommend hiring him.
googleReviewsBySlug.json.responseFromOwnerText: I'm sorry you feel this way. But let's be correct and truthful with our facts. For one you offered the money for the trouble of working on the installation that couldn't be done properly because you wanted to reuse the old housing junction box and downrod from prior fan. I told you upfront that I would try but couldn't guarantee much less warranty it being installed like that. I'm sorry I had a severe medical emergency and had to be away for two days which I told you at the start of the job that if I receive a call from the hospital I would have to go. The wires was not cut to short. That is the end of the wiring that extends from the ceiling to the end of the four foot downrod to the fan. The fan was disconnected and that is the wiring left to work with. This is why I suggested to have me come back to install the fan correctly from the ceiling. You agreed. I went to pick up there equipment for this. I contacted you to let you know of my status, I immediately contacted you soon as I learned from the rental place that I could not leave with the equipment with out first getting a truck large enough to safely transport it. I told you that I would make accomedations to do this first thing in the morning. Now without discussing this with me you choose to send me a text at 8pm telling me you don't want me to complete. Ma'am I'm sorry that you were inconvienced while trying to install the fan. I did mention to you at the time of the quote that I was backed up and it may be several days before I could get to you. Unless I did your projects in stages in my evening time after my already scheduled jobs. You said very kindly and several times assuring me that you were in no hurry and for me to only come when I have free time. I came two days later and completed your first set of five projects in the same day. It was agreed upon that even though I originally said payment could be done after completion of all projects. This was before I was informed that you had to special order the fan and delivery date was several days(week+) later than start date. We agreed it was no problem to combine the fan quote onto a separate invoice hence the uncertain shipping date. The remaining projects would be included on a individual invoice after completion of all said projects, which was. So, please don't assert that I insisted on being paid on a job before completion, I completed all work that I received payment on prior to receiving payment. The kind offer of $20 was made to me for the trouble of working on a fan that was impossible to install the method you wanted to use. I never insisted on you giving a payment on the fan for labor I didn't do. Once again I am truly sorry you are unhappy with your experience with us.
googleReviewsBySlug.json.title: Shamrock Home Repairs

googleReviewsBySlug.json.name: The Hamiltons
googleReviewsBySlug.json.text: Hired Raymond to move a heavy desk unit and a workbench. They struggled with the weight of it And I think I tested their limits but ultimately they got the job done without damaging the items. Thanks guys.
googleReviewsBySlug.json.responseFromOwnerText: Glad we were able to help! Would've definitely brought additional help lol! Didn't realize how heavy or large it was going to be. 🙄 Trying to give my 19yro son in law some with experience and toughen him up a little, he's never had to really work in his life until recently meeting me.🤔 Anyways give us a call if you ever need any help with anything. We are more efficient repairing and constructing. Gotta leave all that heavy lifting to the young guys from now on.
googleReviewsBySlug.json.title: Shamrock Home Repairs

googleReviewsBySlug.json.name: Mary Steele
googleReviewsBySlug.json.responseFromOwnerText: Thank you for your positive review. We're happy you were satisfied with our service.
googleReviewsBySlug.json.title: Shamrock Home Repairs

googleReviewsBySlug.json.name: Kelly McDaniel
googleReviewsBySlug.json.text: I take it back. Did good on my roofing job but second job was a complete disaster. I'm done with contractors. Complete and total mess.
googleReviewsBySlug.json.responseFromOwnerText: We're very sorry that your job was completed to your satisfaction. Sometimes when coming behind a previous contractors to correct mistakes it limits your ability to fully correct the problem without starting new, which brings more expense. We're always happy to come out and correct any work by is that your not satisfied with. In your situation, the lumber that was used for your porch ceiling had already weathered and warped due to prior contractor only using one nail in middle of the decking plank, which behind to warp downward towards the ground after it's been exposed to weather. This makes splitting, cracking of planks when attempting to fasten the planks correctly. Without replacing the lumber itself our options were limited. Again, we apologize for your dissatisfaction on the service your received from us. If there's anyway we can current this please give us a call. Glad to hear of your satisfaction of your roof repair. We strive to please reach one of our customers.
googleReviewsBySlug.json.title: Shamrock Home Repairs

googleReviewsBySlug.json.name: Matt Langford
googleReviewsBySlug.json.responseFromOwnerText: Thank you Matt for the review. We strive to provide all our customers with the best service possible.
googleReviewsBySlug.json.title: Shamrock Home Repairs

plumberResearchFull.json:
### Business Information:

#### Alabama Business Registration/License Details
While the specific details of Shamrock Home Repairs' business registration or licenses in Alabama are not provided in the sources, it is clear that any business operating in Huntsville, AL, would need to comply with local and state regulations. For instance, businesses in Alabama typically need to register with the Alabama Secretary of State and obtain necessary local business licenses, as indicated in general business license requirements[1].

#### Physical Location and Service Areas
Shamrock Home Repairs is located at 138 Rose Dr, Huntsville, AL 35811. The business serves several areas including Huntsville, Madison, Hazel Green, New Market, Gurley, Toney, and Meridianville[5].

#### Hours and Payment Methods
There is no specific information available on the business hours or payment methods for Shamrock Home Repairs.

#### Years in Operation
The exact years in operation for Shamrock Home Repairs are not specified in the provided sources. However, the BBB file for the business was opened on May 6, 2021, which suggests it has been operating at least since then[2].

### Services & Specialties:

#### Types of Services Offered
Shamrock Home Repairs offers a wide range of services including handyman work, home repairs, plumbing, roofing, light to moderate electrical work, and door replacement[5].

#### Service Areas Covered
As mentioned, the service areas include Huntsville, Madison, Hazel Green, New Market, Gurley, Toney, and Meridianville[5].

#### Emergency Service Availability
There is no specific information available on whether Shamrock Home Repairs offers emergency services.

#### Listed Prices or Rates
No specific prices or rates are listed in the provided sources.

### Customer Reviews & Reputation:

#### Review Summaries with Specific Examples
The reviews for Shamrock Home Repairs are largely negative, particularly those found on the BBB website. Customers have reported issues such as poor work quality, unprofessional behavior, and failure to address customer complaints. For example, one customer reported that the company did a shoddy job on their chimney repair, leading to significant damage and safety issues[3].

#### BBB Rating and Status
Shamrock Home Repairs is not BBB accredited and does not have a BBB rating due to being out of business according to the BBB profile[2].

#### Common Customer Feedback Themes
Common themes include poor workmanship, unprofessional behavior of technicians, failure to complete jobs as promised, and lack of response to customer complaints[3].

#### Response to Reviews
The business has not responded to the complaints filed on the BBB website, as indicated by the status of the complaints being "unanswered"[3].

### Owner & Staff:

#### Owner/Management Information
The principal contact and owner of Shamrock Home Repairs is Raymond Roop[2].

#### Staff Qualifications
There is no specific information available on the qualifications or professional certifications of the staff at Shamrock Home Repairs.

#### Professional Certifications
No information is provided on any professional certifications held by the staff or owner of Shamrock Home Repairs.
aboutUs: Shamrock Home Repairs is a trusted local plumbing and home repair company serving the Huntsville, AL area. Our team of skilled professionals specializes in a wide range of services including plumbing, roofing, electrical work, and door replacements. With a focus on quality workmanship and customer satisfaction, we are committed to providing exceptional service to homeowners throughout Huntsville, Madison, Hazel Green, and surrounding communities.

whyChooseUs.mainPitch: Experience the peace of mind that comes with choosing Huntsville's premier plumbing and home repair experts.
sellingPoints: Fully licensed and insured professionals with extensive knowledge of local building codes and regulations.
Comprehensive range of services from plumbing and roofing to electrical work and handyman repairs, all under one roof.
Commitment to using high-quality materials and employing proven techniques to ensure long-lasting solutions.
